title: Andoid 8.0 Update: When does my phone get Oreo?

**When will my Android phone get version 8.0 Oreo?**

Android 8.0 Oreo is here – sort of. If you’re rocking a [Google
Pixel](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/google-pixel) or recent Nexus
device then you can taste that Oreo right now, but if you’re one of the many
Android users that aren’t then you might be in for a long wait.

## Essential Phone Android 8.0 update

Essential is the new kid on the block when it comes to Android phones, and we
haven’t even seen the bezel-free phone in the UK yet. But, it seems that it’s
about to get the Android Oreo update.

**Related:[Not interested in Android? Check out our iOS 11
review](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/ios-11)**

## Pixel/Nexus Android 8.0 update

Let’s start with an easy one, shall we? Considering they’re the phones made to
be adverts for the latest versions of Android, it’s hardly a surprise Google’s
own Pixel and Nexus handsets get a quick update.

Android 8.0 Oreo is rolling out to Pixel, Pixel XL, [Pixel
C](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/google-pixel-c), [Nexus
6P](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/nexus-6p) and [Nexus
5X](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/nexus-5x) owners in the coming
weeks and factory images and OTA links are available right now on the Android
Developers website.

9](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/nexus-9) won’t be getting Android
Oreo and you’ll be stuck forever on 7.1.1.

You’ll also have O straight out-of-the-box if you pick up a [Pixel

## HTC Android 8.0 update

> We're excited to bring Android 8.0 to the HTC U11, U Ultra, & 10, beginning
with U11 in Q4. Stay tuned for more Oreo details & new products!
[pic.twitter.com/B2Os1tOONP](https://t.co/B2Os1tOONP)

>

> — HTC USA (@HTCUSA) [August 24,
2017](https://twitter.com/HTCUSA/status/900794911045242880?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

HTC has already announced that its 2017 flagship, the [HTC
U11](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/htc-U-11), will be getting a taste
of Oreo before we welcome in 2018. In a tweet sent from the official HTC USA
account, the Taiwanese brand also said that Android 8.0 is coming to the [HTC
U Ultra](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/htc-u-ultra) and last year’s
[HTC 10](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/htc-10).

Q4 is the only timeframe given, but hopefully these updates will start rolling
out before the festive season hits.

**Related:[Samsung Galaxy S8 vs iPhone

Things are a bit murkier for non-flagship, and older, HTC devices but we’ll
update this list when we know more.

## Samsung Android 8.0 update

Samsung isn’t historically known for getting Android updates out quickly, but
there are some rumours that might change with Android Oreo. There has been
rumblings that Samsung is already working on an update to its two best phones
of the year – the [Samsung Galaxy
S8](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-s8) and S8 Plus.

**Related:[Samsung Galaxy Note 8
review](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-note-8)**

Though, until we receive something official from the Korean company we won’t
know for sure when we’ll see Android 8.0 Oreo.

## Sony Android 8.0 update

Sony might be lagging behind the competition with the actual phones it
produces, but it is looking to be one of the top performers when it comes to
quickly getting Oreo out to devices.

The [Sony Xperia XZ1](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz1)
and [XZ1 Compact](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-
xz1-compact), both announced at IFA 2017, will come with Oreo installed when
they start shipping later in September.

It’s not just flagship Xperia devices that will getting Oreo, in fact a whole
load of Sony phones are set to be upgraded.

Here is the complete list:

  * [Sony Xperia X](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-x)
  * Sony Xperia X Performance
  * [Sony Xperia XZ](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz)
  * Sony Xperia X Compact
  * [Sony Xperia XZ Premium](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz-premium)
  * [Sony Xperia XA1](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xa1)
  * Sony Xperia XA1 Ultra
  * Sony Xperia XZs

We don’t yet know when these updates will start hitting devices.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

## Huawei Android 8.0 update

Huawei tends to release a phone early in the year and then another towards the
end. This year we’re expecting the [Huawei
P10](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/huawei-p10) to be joined by the
Mate 10 in October.

In previous years the Mate series has shipped with the latest update onboard;
the [Mate 8](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/huawei-mate-8) came with
the [Marshmallow](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/android-marshmallow),
while the [Mate 9](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/huawei-mate-9)
shipped with Nougat. If the pattern continues, hopefully the Mate 10 will ship
with Oreo already installed.

We’re not sure when, or if, the other Huawei devices will receive the update.

The brand-new [Huawei Mate 10](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/huawei-
mate-10) and 10 Pro both ship with Android Oreo, so at least we know Huawei
has a stable build ready.

## LG Android 8.0 update

LG kicked off the 2017 trend of slimming down thick bezel with the [LG
G6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/lg-g6), and followed it up with
what looks to be a fantastic phone in the form of the [LG
V30](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/lg-v30).

But unlike the LG V20, which shipped with Android 7.0 Nougat, the V30 won’t be
running the latest version of Android when it’s plucked from store shelves.

**Related:[LG V30 vs Samsung Galaxy
S8](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/lg-v30-vs-galaxy-s8-3275821)**

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

We haven’t yet had any concrete information on when LG’s phones will be
receiving Oreo, but we’ll update this page when we know more. ****

##  Motorola Android 8.0 update

Once renowned for its snappy updates, Motorola hasn’t been quite so consistent
in recent times. Thankfully, we have already got confirmation from Motorola
that certain devices will be seeing Oreo soon.

  * Moto Z2 Force 
  * [Moto Z2 Play](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/moto-z2-play)
  * Moto Z Force 
  * [Moto Z](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/moto-z)
  * Moto Z Play
  * [Moto G5S Plus](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/moto-g5s-plus)
  * [Moto G5 Plus](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/moto-g5-plus)
  * [Moto G5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/motorola-moto-g)

That covers all the main 2017 devices from Moto, aside from the Moto E4, but
it is missing the notable older devices from 2016. The Moto G4, G4 Plus and
Moto G4 Play are all absent from the list which is something of a
disappointment.

There’s also no mention of an update for the recently announced [Moto
X4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/moto-x4), though could simply be
because it’s not even out yet.

## OnePlus Android 8.0 update

The OnePlus 5 is one of our very favourite Android phones of 2017, and it’s
the best device from the growing Chinese upstarts yet.

A lot of what makes the [OnePlus
5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/oneplus-5) so great is the lack of
needless extras in its software, which is very similar to stock Android you’d
find on a Pixel phone.

It seems that OnePlus is already in the process of testing out its Oreo
update, with some [OnePlus
3](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/oneplus-3) users already receiving
the update through a special closed beta programme. We’d expect this beta to
be expanded to other users before the update goes live for all.

**Related:[OnePlus 5 vs iPhone
7](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/oneplus-5-vs-iphone-7-2952355)**

##  Nokia Android 8.0 update

2017 has been a huge year for the Nokia brand, and its owners HMD. Along with
resurrecting the iconic 3310 in slightly shonky fashion, it has produced a
bunch of pretty decent Android phones. The [Nokia
3](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/nokia-3), [Nokia
5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/nokia-5) and [Nokia
6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/nokia-6) hit shelves earlier in the
year and have all been confirmed to be getting the Oreo update at some point.
